column4: London Borough of Tower Hamlets — Lowder House Development
column5: Design and Build of 18 New Build Homes at Lowder House.(Reardon and Lowder Houses, Reardon Street and Wapping Lane, London, E1W).
column6: The Lowder House development sits on the corner between Reardon House and Lowder House in Wapping and is currently occupied by a concrete hardstanding and garages within surrounding residential properties. Planning approval was obtained in June 2019 to demolish the existing garages and to construct a new residential 4-6 storey block containing 18 x 1, 2 and 3 bedroom flats with a covered parking garage. 10 % of homes will be located at street-entrance level for full wheelchair-accessibility (Approved Document M4 (3)).The scheme will deliver 18 affordable flats as follows7 x 1 bed5 x 2 bed4 x 3 bed2 x 3 bed (wc).This tender was awarded through the solution development contractors facilitated by the Procurement Hub.

column4: London Borough of Tower Hamlets — Mellish Street
column5: Design and Build of 22 New Homes and Community Facilities at Mellish Street, London, E14 8PJ.
column6: The site at 111-113 Mellish Street was previously used as a nursery annex to Seven Mills Primary School. The development site is currently occupied by a single storey modular building that covers a large portion of the site, with the remainder used as surface car parking. Planning approval was obtained in September 2019 to demolish the existing building and construct a 5-storey block providing 22 high quality homes for rent, a three storey community facility and a communal garden centred between the two new buildingsThis mixed development scheme will deliver the 22 homes as 100 % affordable homes for rent as follows:9 x 1 bed8 x 2 bed5 x 3 bed.This tender was awarded through the solution development contractors facilitated by the Procurement Hub.

column4: Whole House Refurbishment and Associated Works
column5: The provision of works for whole house refurbishment projects for public sector organisations in regional lots throughout the UK. The arrangement will be awarded under 2 main workstreams:(i) workstream 1: whole house refurbishment — specialisms, covering kitchens and bathrooms and associated works, landscaping, electrical works, painting and decoration and heating services (Scotland only).(ii) Workstream 2: multi-disciplinary services, covering a wide range of whole house refurbishment works, including the specialist works in workstream 1. Workstream 2 will include the following key works:— heating and electrical,— disabled adaptations,— supply, renewal of gas fired central heating and upgrading of boilers,— electric heating installations,— roofing,— electrical wiring,— cladding,— renewal of windows and doors, including fire doors,— fire detection, suppression systems, sprinklers.Please see the tender service specifications for more details.
column6: Provision of whole house refurbishment services for workstream 1 - 4 specialist services, comprising; kitchens and bathrooms with associated repairs, landscaping, electrical works, painting and decorating.This lot is open to suppliers bidding for works in the GBP 250 000 to GBP 2 million annualised value band.

The arrangement will be awarded under 2 main workstreams:(i) workstream 1: whole house refurbishment — specialisms, covering kitchens and bathrooms and associated works, landscaping, electrical works, painting and decoration and heating services (Scotland only).(ii) Workstream 2: multi-disciplinary services, covering a wide range of whole house refurbishment works, including the specialist works in workstream 1. Workstream 2 will include the following key works:— heating and electrical,— disabled adaptations,— supply, renewal of gas fired central heating and upgrading of boilers,— electric heating installations,— roofing,— electrical wiring,— cladding,— renewal of windows and doors, including fire doors,— fire detection, suppression systems, sprinklers.Please see the tender service specifications for more details.
column6: Provision of Whole House Refurbishment Services for Workstream 1 - 4 Specialist services, comprising;Kitchens & Bathrooms with Associated Repairs, Landscaping, Electrical works, Painting & Decorating.This Lot is open to suppliers bidding for works in the £250k to £2m annualised Value Band.

The arrangement will be awarded under 2 main workstreams:(i) workstream 1: whole house refurbishment — specialisms, covering kitchens and bathrooms and associated works, landscaping, electrical works, painting and decoration and heating services (Scotland only).(ii) Workstream 2: multi-disciplinary services, covering a wide range of whole house refurbishment works, including the specialist works in workstream 1. Workstream 2 will include the following key works:— heating and electrical,— disabled adaptations,— supply, renewal of gas fired central heating and upgrading of boilers,— electric heating installations,— roofing,— electrical wiring,— cladding,— renewal of windows and doors, including fire doors,— fire detection, suppression systems, sprinklers.Please see the tender service specifications for more details.
column6: Provision of Whole House Refurbishment Services for Workstream 1 - 4 Specialist services, comprising;Kitchens & Bathrooms with Associated Repairs, Landscaping, Electrical works, Painting & Decorating.This Lot is open to suppliers bidding for works in the £250k to £2m annualised Value Band.

column4: FM20014 — Installation of a New HV Supply and Substation.
column5: UK Shared Business Services Ltd acting on behalf of the contracting authority have put in place a contract for the installation of a new HV Supply and Substation. This requirement will be set out in two phases. Phase 1 will be the substation 45 and phase 2 will be the substation nine panel extension.
column6: Phase 1: Substation 45. Breakdown of works:— carry out soil resistivity study and provide subsequent earthing design;— carry out ground penetrating radar of proposed cable route and substation location to determine presence of other services in the area;— produce protection settings for new installation, which will account for protection relays upstream of the new substation location (site protection study provided by client);— establish site setup for materials, waste, herras fencing etc;— civil contractor to excavate approx. 180 m trench suitable for 11kv cable, including 1x road crossing, and direct lay 11 kV 3c 185 mmconfirmed. (Provisional route shown as per Appendix 1);— civil contractor to install both LV and HV earth mat as per earthing design;— civil contractor to create new substation compound, complete with plinths, fencing etc;— procure 1 000 kVA, 11 000 v/415 v KNAN TX with close coupled RN2D with VIP.Protection and standard LV box as per Appendix 2.— isolate RSW within SS 35 and issue PTW for all jointing works;— commission new installation;— Produce O&M Manual for new installation.Phase 2 :substation nine panel extension. breakdown of works:— carry out ground penetrating radar of proposed cable route and substation location to determine presence of other services in the area;— civil contractor to excavate approx. 210 m trench suitable for 11 kv cable, including dig and lay within the road and install 11 kV 3c 185 mm— procure and install 630A Genie Evo Panel with suitable protection relay. Specification of panel to be agreed;— commission/test new cable and 11 kV panel;— update site records and drawings as required.

column4: Asphalt Supply Framework
column5: Corserv Ltd acting on behalf of Cormac Solutions Ltd requires providers to supply coated stone on a framework agreement. The requirement of the framework agreement is to supply coated stone by delivery or ex works collection as and when required.The estimated value is likely to be in the region of GBP 6 000 000 per annum. The potential estimated total value is likely to exceed this range of spend if other organisations decide to participate.The intention is to let a 12-month framework arrangement with the option of three, 12-month extensions.

column4: Blood Mixers
column5: SNBTS requires Automatic blood mixing devices that includes automated data collection and capture as this is an integral part of the SNBTS OSDR whole blood collection process. These requirements are needed to ensure effective mixing of the donation with the anti-coagulant and assist in ensuring donations remain within set parameters and accurate automatic data capture/storage and upload into individual donor records.
column6: SNBTS requires automatic blood mixing devices that includes automated data collection and capture as this is an integral part of the SNBTS OSDR whole blood collection process. These requirements are needed to ensure effective mixing of the donation with the anti-coagulant and assist in ensuring donations remain within set parameters and accurate automatic data capture/storage and upload into individual donor records.To allow realisation of the OSDR programme SNBTS Donor Services require to purchase automated blood mixing devices that can assist in achieving the overall planned programme of digital improvement using new technologies. SNBTS require to place an order for a total of 200 blood mixers in the immediate term.

column6: SFRS have a requirement to procure up to four portable satellite communication terminals with associated services with the potential for ad-hoc ordering thereafter. column4: Infant Feeding and Associated Accessories
column5: The framework agreement will look to include the following range of products: milks prepared feed, powdered milk, breast milk fortifier, drinks, distilled water, fruit juice and meals, infant meal from 4 months, infant meal from 7 months, infant snacks, infant desserts, infant breakfast, infant bottles, disposable, reusable, feeding cups, teats — latex, latex free, specialist, soothers — latex, latex free, specialist, sterilisers, breast pumps and accessories, breast pump, nipple shields, breast pads, breast creams, breast pump sets, protective membrane. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 8 000 000 in the first year of this framework agreement, however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement. The estimated value over the total framework agreement term is 32 000 000.
column6: Term and pre-term infant feed including: powdered infant formula, gluten free powdered infant formula,prepared ready to use infant formula including hungry, gluten free and low allergen variants, breast milk fortifier,breakfast meals for babies (fruit and/or cereal based such as rice or oats), savoury meals for babies (to have an appetising taste and smell with taste characteristics tending to umami, not sweet), desserts for babies (taste characteristics to be sweet), infant snacks including biscuits, infant drinks including distilled water, flavoured water and fruit juices.

column4: Car Hire Concession Contract
column5: Cornwall Airport Ltd has appointed suppliers of Car Hire to operate concessions at Cornwall Airport Newquay. The objective of this procurement is to invite proposals from suitable providers of car hire services with a view to agreeing a contract for 3 years, with an option to extend for a further 2 years.
column6: Cornwall Airport Ltd requires all concessions to operate for all arriving scheduled and chartered flights and to provide a service for any passengers on delayed or diverted flights who have pre-booked a vehicle. The minimum requirement is for concessions to be open to meet and greet all pre-bookings. The concession must operate 7 days per week, 365 days of the year.

column4: Car Hire Concession Contract

The objective of this procurement is to invite proposals from suitable providers of car hire services with a view to agreeing a contract for 3 years, with an option to extend for a further 2 years.

column4: Featherstone High School and Woodlands Academy Catering Tender
column5: Featherstone High School is a fully inclusive school focused on the needs of each individual; they want all their students to taste success and to be rewarded for that success.Woodlands Academy ensures every one of their pupils has wide ranging opportunities to succeed in life, starting at their local school. The school has an enviable track record in raising standards of achievement and significantly increasing the progress made by pupils.

column3: Maintenance services of public-lighting installations and traffic lights
column4: WDC — Provision of Seasonal Lights for Leamington Spa, Warwickshire
column5: Warwick District Council (WDC) is committed to displaying Christmas lights in Leamington Spa during the seasonal period, usually from November until January. Therefore WDC, in conjunction with BID Leamington and Leamington Town Council will be issuing a tender this year to select a supplier to erect Christmas illuminations in the Leamington Spa town centre.The contract will require the provision of: some/all illuminations, infrastructure, testing (illuminations, timers, and anchor bolts), installation, maintenance, removal and storage of the illuminations.The duration of this contract will be 4 years with an option to extend for a further 12 months.
column6: Tenders are invited for the provision of seasonal illuminations throughout Leamington Spa town centre, including:— providing and maintaining the illuminations;— maintaining the associated infrastructure (including testing of catenary cables and hanging fittings, yearly anchor bolts testing);— installation and testing of the illuminations;— removal and storage of the illuminations.The contract is expected to commence on 14 June 2019. The contract shall be for 4 years with the option to extend for up to a further 12 months, subject to funding confirmation and satisfactory performance of the provider and at the agreement of all parties.

column4: Transportation of Waste from Banbridge, Dromore and Rathfriland Recycling Centres
column5: This tender is for the transportation of various waste material from Banbridge, Dromore and Rathfriland Recycling Centres to specified locations for reprocessing/disposal on behalf of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council. The initial contract period will be from the date stated in the award letter to 31 August 2021 with the option to extend for a further 12 months.

The initial contract period will be from the date stated in the award letter to 31 August 2021 with the option to extend for a further 12 months.

column4: Provision of Cleaning and Ancillary Services for Sport Wales National Centre
column5: The Centre recognises the need to provide a clean, safe welcoming environment for all its staff, residents and visitors. The cleaning and ancillary services team at the Centre are committed to this aim and provide a high standard of service to all users of Centre facilities.The Centre is looking for an experienced cleaning and ancillary services contractor who can provide a team of operatives who will fit into the existing system and work diligently alongside the Centre team.The requirement is to provide services at Sport Wales National Centre, Sophia Gardens, Cardiff, CF11 9SW.
column6: The contractor will be required to complete the cleaning specification and the following ancillary services:— pest control service,— waste disposal and recycling,— sanitary disposal units — provision/emptying,— provision/replenishment of toilet rolls in staff and public toilets and paper towels,— provision and emptying of clinical waste units,— provision and replenishment of black bags and cleaning materials and equipment,— clean and replace dust absorbent mats,— window cleaning,— catering equipment deep cleaning,— removal of crockery to kitchen,— additional day cleaning operatives as requested subject to event programme.

column4: Employee Assistance Programme and Professional Support
column5: The provision of an Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) and professional support is to support the forces’ wellbeing agenda and effective attendance management for the forces.The broad objectives of EMCHRS OH are:— to promote a culture of good attendance and increase attendance rates;— to improve the overall health of our people and to promote a healthy working environment:— to operate a ‘lean’ service for the function;— to provide professional, competent, qualified staff delivering the service.The forces involved in this framework are Leicestershire Police, Derbyshire Constabulary and Northamptonshire Police. There is an option for Nottinghamshire and Lincolnshire Police forces to join at a later date.

There is an option for Nottinghamshire and Lincolnshire Police forces to join at a later date.

column4: Supply and Installation of an Integrated CCTV Control System for Aberdeen
column5: Aberdeen City Council intended to implement an Integrated camera operations facility for the coordinated use of existing traffic monitoring, public safety and security cameras across the City of Aberdeen.
column6: Aberdeen City Council intends to implement an integrated camera operations facility for the coordinated use of existing traffic monitoring, public safety and security cameras across the City of Aberdeen. This will require integration of the Council’s camera equipment and associated back office monitoring and control facilities for Traffic, housing and estates services with those of Police Scotland in Aberdeen. Each of these services currently operate largely in isolation at several locations across the city, using different cameras, camera monitoring and control systems and communications protocols. The Council proposes the installation and operation of a single integrated video management system (VMS) at the operations facility at Marischal College in Aberdeen to allow operations staff to monitor and control all available Council and Police cameras in the city (a combined total of approximately 600 cameras). This work will include retention, replacement, upgrade or removal of all of these cameras following a detailed assessment of each camera location to be undertaken by the successful bidder following Award of contract.In addition to the above requirements, the Council wishes to consider facilities to improve operational effectiveness, including more rapid and better informed responses to incidents and events by the Council and Police supported by the latest technological advances in automated and intelligent video monitoring, detection and alerting.

column4: Provision of Enteral Feeding Pumps, Feeds and Consumables to Hospital Sites and the Provision of a Home Delivery Service for The Harrogate Area
column5: The authority is seeking offers for (adults and children) and the CCG as an integrated service across the Harrogate Health Economy for the provision of enteral feeding pumps, feeds and consumables to hospital sites as specified and the provision of a home delivery service for community patients within the boundaries of Harrogate and District NHS Foundation Trust. This requirement is based on an ‘on-FP10’ proposal.
column6: Provision of enteral feeding pumps, feeds and consumables to Hospital Sites and the Provision of a Home Delivery Service for the Harrogate Health Economy.

column4: Network Maintenance
column5: We are looking to tender our network maintenance and project work requirements. We currently have Cisco, Dell and Juniper hardware. We require a 4 hour fix for network kit and Wifi/NAPS on premises and require support at our locations 24/365 (including Public Holidays).We have approximately 500 network devices, are looking to use the Belden catalogue for physical cable and connection requirements and require you to be a Cisco Partner and access to an improved Belden installer (or equivalent).Project work will cover the full project services including IT liaison and a fully costed, delivered and supported solution.The contract period will be for 5 years plus two optional periods of a year. Maximum 7 years.
column6: We are looking to tender our network maintenance and project work requirements. We currently have Cisco, Dell and Juniper hardware. We require a 4 hour fix for network kit and Wifi/NAPS at our premises and require support at our locations 24/365 (including Public Holidays).We have approximately 500 network devices, are looking to use the Belden catalogue for physical cable and connection requirements and require you to be a Cisco Partner and access to an improved Belden installer (or equivalent).Project will cover the full project services including IT liaison and a fully costed, delivered and supported solution.The contract period will be for 5 years plus two optional periods of a year. Maximum 7 years.

column4: CPH024 Targeted Substance Misuse Service for Children and Young People
column5: A single provider to deliver a targeted substance misuse service for children and young people under the Light Touch Regime (LTR) to screen higher risk populations throughout Derbyshire (excluding Derby City) in order to identify young people using drugs or alcohol and other psychoactive substances; deliver interventions aimed at reducing harm and refer to the specialist service where more intensive support is required.
column6: A single provider to deliver a targeted substance misuse service for children and young people under the Light Touch Regime (LTR) to screen higher risk populations throughout Derbyshire (excluding Derby City) in order to identify young people using drugs or alcohol and other psychoactive substances; deliver interventions aimed at reducing harm and refer to the specialist service where more intensive support is required.The contract start date will be 1 June 2020 to 31 March 2022 with the option to extend for a further 2 years up to 31 March 2024.There will be an implementation period of 3 months prior to the contract start date.Please note that the contract price is fixed at GBP 112 000 per annum for the contract term up to 31 March 2024.(Please note the amount will be pro rata for the first 10 months of the service).

column3: Repair and maintenance services of building installations
column4: Reactive Repair Contract 2020-23
column5: The reactive repairs contract will be for a period of 5 years, it will initially run for 3 years and then will have the option to extend for a further 2-year period at Ochil View Housing Associations discretion and agreed on an annual basis.The works comprise of the reactive repairs to occupied homes and void repairs to empty homes. This also includes a full out of hours repairs service, 365 days a year. All trades should be provided (e.g. joinery, plumbing, electrical, building and roofing work).The contract will be divided into two lots (Alloa and West Fife and Tullibody and Hillfoots) with each comprising around 700 homes.

column4: DurhamWorks Provider Panel for Employment Routeways 2020-2021
column5: DurhamWorks is looking to develop a panel of multiple providers who can deliver tailored bespoke support to 16-24 year-old participants who are not in education, employment or training/unemployed with a specific focus of progressing participants into paid employment. This will be an open and flexible arrangement where at the discretion of the Council the panel can be re-opened to allow additional providers to join the provider panel.The Provider Panel Agreement provides for no form of exclusivity or volume guarantee by the Council for services from the provider and that the Council is at all times entitled to enter into other contracts and agreements with other providers for the provision of any services. Each provider should understand that their submission constitutes an acceptance to the Council of the terms of the Provider Panel Agreement and merely affords the provider the opportunity to respond to invitation from the Council for the provision of services (Competed Call-Offs).
column6: DurhamWorks is looking to develop a provider panel of multiple providers which can deliver tailored bespoke support to 16-24 year-old participants who are not in education, employment or training (NEET)/unemployed with a specific focus of progressing participants into paid employment. Other outcomes may be fundable but payment terms will be defined per each competed call-off.This will be an open and flexible arrangement where at the discretion of the Council the panel can be re-opened to allow additional providers to join the provider panel.

column4: Provision of Security and Stewarding Services 046-2019
column5: Manchester Central is currently looking for a contractor to provide and manage workers for event services consisting of security and stewarding.
column6: The contractor shall provide security services, which includes building security and stewarding services on a call-off basis for all internal and external areas.The contractor shall provide a professionally managed, high- quality security, guarding service that has BS7858:2012 – Security screening of individuals employed in a security environment and BS7499:2007 – Static guarding and mobile patrol or equivalent accreditation and complies with all legislation governing the security industry.The contractor shall provide a professionally managed, high- quality event stewarding service which complies with BS8406:2009The contractor shall also have options to provide high- quality close protection staff, canine teams, CCTV monitoring staff and concierge to the employer on an as required basis.There will be an opportunity for a site visit to Manchester Central on Tuesday 3Please email procurement@manchestercentral.co.uk with the names of those attendees wishing to join the site visit by 4 p.m. on Monday 2

column3: Architectural, construction, engineering and inspection services
column4: DE 2239303 — Appointment of an Integrated Consultant Team for Coleraine Grammar School — Development Proposal Works
column5: The objective of this procurement is the provision of construction related professional services by a team of consultants and their supply chain, collectively referred to as the Integrated Consultant Team (ICT). The ICT will actively develop the employer's requirements, prepare the concept and developed design for new teaching accommodation building(s), internal refurbishment and associated siteworks and shall provide professional services applicable to all RIBA Plan of Work 2013 Stage 1-7. The contract will be awarded to the ICT which has submitted the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT) based on the narrow average price scoring mechanism. For full description refer to invitation to tender, Document 3 of 4 — scope of services.

column4: DE 2155420 Appointment of an ICT for Enniskillen Royal Grammar School
column5: The appointment of a project manager led integrated consultant team to include: project management, provision of architectural, structural, civil, building services design, and lead designer services for input and development of design proposals to RIBA Plan of Work 2013 Stage 4 and to successfully obtain planning approval prior to engaging upon the procurement of an integrated supply team (IST) to undertake the construction of the new School. Thereafter providing advisory, technical review, monitoring and supervision of the IST and audit services throughout the construction of the works. The contract will be awarded to the economic operator which has submitted the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT) using the narrow average, price scoring mechanism. Refer to draft ITT Document 1 of 4. For a complete description of this procurement, please refer to the pre-qualification questionnaire package.

column4: London and Quadrant Housing Trust — Sales and Marketing — Public Relations Agency (Post-Planning) (London) 2020-2024
column5: London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250 000 people in more than 95 000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Public Relations Agency (Post-Planning) (London) 2020 - 2024 for London and Quadrant’s self delivered new build projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a framework agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This tender is for Service providers only.
column6: This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for restricted OJEU tenders.Stage 1: Selection Stage Click on the ‘Express Interest’ Button at the bottom click on the ‘Selection Stage’ Tab at the top— scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the tender documents and access the standard selection questionnaire;— for the selection Stage you will only need to submit the standard selection questionnaire;— we will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not;— pricing documents will only be available to those who have passed the selection stage.Stage 2: ITT stage— click on the ‘ITT’ Tab;— scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the tender documents;— tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. Under the framework agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other social housing providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the framework agreement. ‘Social Housing Provider’ for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, registered providers, local authorities and ALMOs. Such social housing providers will only be entitled to call off under the framework agreement if L&Q consents. For information regarding this tender please contact the framework team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the framework buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact group procurement for information as this tender has been created by the framework buying department.

column4: One HMG Healthcare Service Provision
column5: Access to NHS standards of healthcare for HMG staff and family members serving overseas
column6: The aim of the scheme is to provide access to NHS standards of medical and dental care, as far as practicable, for staff and qualifying dependants posted overseas. Where this is not practicable, the risks must be understood by the contractor and made clear to the authority and users.The service requirement is complex and challenging. The contractor will be required to provide access to medical and dental care worldwide in all types of environments. The contractor must also be able to refer cases back into the NHS system or the Defence Medical Services (DMS) when required. The user populations are varied and include many foreign-born staff members and partners who may not have automatic entitlement to the NHS, this will provide a challenge for the contractor to look at innovative solutions to the provision of care for this group.Further information can be found in the invitation to tender documents hosted on the FCO's eProcurement portal, JAGGAER (https://fco.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html)Project_2479 / ITT_3057

column4: Multi-Storey Condition Surveys
column5: Renfrewshire Council wishes to appoint a specialist consultant that has architectural, energy efficiency, stock condition surveying, quantity surveying and structural engineering skills and experience, in order to carry out condition surveys of our fourteen (14) multi-storey blocks.
column6: Renfrewshire Council wishes to appoint a specialist consultant that has architectural, energy efficiency, stock condition surveying, quantity surveying and structural engineering skills and experience, in order to carry out condition surveys of our fourteen (14) multi-storey blocks.Renfrewshire Council requires an external assessment of these blocks and a recommendation in terms of the condition and any works, both repair and improvement, that will be required to maintain them to an acceptable standard over the coming 20 year period in order to meet both the Energy Efficiency standard for Social Housing (EESSH) and the Scottish Housing Quality Standard (SHQS).

column4: DE 2188568 Appointment of EOT for Slemish College Ballymena
column5: The objective of this procurement process is to successfully appoint an Economic operator team (EOT) who will actively develop the employer’s brief for the design and delivery of a new Post Primary Slemish College Ballymena. The successfully appointed EOT shall provide the professional services applicable to RIBA (2013) Stages 0 to 7 as identified in call for tender contract documentation and information.The EOT shall develop the design to RIBA (2013) Stage 3 exemplar developed design before appointing and managing an Integrated supply team (IST) to further develop the detail/technical design and deliver the project throughout all remaining RIBA Plan of Work (2013) Stages 4 to 7. The contract will be awarded to the E0T which has submitted the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT) using the narrow average price scoring mechanism — refer to draft ITT Document 1 of 4. For a complete description of this procurement refer to CfT contract documents and draft ITT scope of services.

column4: WSCC DR — Public Health Services
column5: A contract for the provision of public health services, as described in Documents 2a-g (Service Specification) (‘the Contract’) is being tendered by West Sussex County Council (‘the Council’) in accordance with the light touch regime (LTR) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) (‘the 2015 Regulations’). The aim of the procurement process is to establish an approved supplier list for Public Health Services in the County of West Sussex. As such, please note that bidders will not be competing with each other for a place on this contract. All bidders who pass the evaluation stage, as detailed in Parts 3 and 4 below will be offered a place on the approved supplier list. The procurement process will be undertaken using the OJEU Open Procedure.
column6: As per the attached tender documents.

column4: Early Learning, Childcare and Brokerage Services
column5: Early learning and childcare and childcare brokerage services are two key strands of statutory childcare services offered to parents and carers of children in Dumfries and Galloway.
column6: The Council has a statutory duty to make pre-school education available for eligible children under the Standards in Scotland’s Schools Act 2000. The children and young people (Scotland) Act 2014 and statutory guidance set out the increased entitlement to 1 140 hours for eligible children and places a duty on the Council to offer increased flexibility to parents as to where and how their child can access their early learning and childcare entitlement. Scottish Government made a commitment to extend the entitlement to all eligible children to 1 140 hours for early learning and childcare by 2020/2021 as set out in ‘A Blueprint for 2020; Expansion of Early Learning and Childcare in Scotland’ (2016).The funding follows the child approach places choice in parents’ and carers’ hands allowing them to access their child’s funded entitlement, therefore the Council are seeking to set up a flexible framework for the provision of early learning and childcare services under the light touch rules contained within the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015. Lot 1 of this flexible framework sets out the minimum standards required from the private, voluntary and independent setting.All providers who apply and meet the national standards, legislation, the Council's procedural requirements as set out in the invitation to tender and accept the rates and contract terms set out by the Council shall be accepted to deliver funded provision through the flexible framework.

column4: Early Learning, Childcare and Brokerage Services
column5: Early learning and childcare and childcare brokerage services are two key strands of statutory childcare services offered to parents and carers of children in Dumfries and Galloway.
column6: The Council has a statutory duty to make pre-school education available for eligible children under the standards in Scotland’s Schools Act 2000. The children and young people (Scotland) Act 2014 and statutory guidance set out the increased entitlement of 600 hours, including the provision for eligible children and places a duty on the Council to offer increased flexibility to parents as to where and how their child can access their early learning and childcare entitlement. Scottish Government has since made a commitment to extend the entitlement to all eligible children to 1 140 hours early learning and childcare by 2020/2021 as set out in ‘A Blueprint for 2020; expansion of early learning and childcare in Scotland’ (2016).The funding follows the child approach places choice in parents’ and carers’ hands allowing them to access their child’s funded entitlement, therefore the Council are seeking to set up a flexible framework for the provision of early learning and childcare services under the light touch rules contained within the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015. Lot 2 of this flexible framework sets out the minimum standards required from the childminders setting.All providers who apply and meet the national standards, legislation, the Council's procedural requirements as set out in the invitation to tender and accept the rates and contract terms set out by the Council shall be able to deliver funded provision through the flexible framework.

column4: Early Learning, Childcare and Brokerage Services
column5: Early learning and childcare and childcare brokerage services are two key strands of statutory childcare services offered to parents and carers of children in Dumfries and Galloway.
column6: Dumfries and Galloway Council social work services provides support to enable vulnerable families to access affordable childcare in times of crisis or to be included in the child’s plan to ensure that their needs are being met. The service is aimed at supporting children aged 2 and under or for young people up to?18 years old if they have?additional support needs and/or?disability.The childcare brokerage model enables parents’ and carers’ to access childcare from any setting, commissioned by the Council – in the public, private or third sector, including from a childminder – who meets the applicable national standards, has a place available and is willing to enter into a contract with the local authority. The national standard, which underpins the approach, will provide parents and carers with the certainty that those settings delivering funded hours are offering high quality brokerage provision. Quality is underpinned by the national standard for early learning and childcare providers.This service is being procured as a lot within a flexible framework under the light touch rules contained within the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.Lot 3 of this Flexible framework sets out the minimum standards required to deliver the childcare brokerage service.All providers who apply and meet the applicable national ELC standards, legislation, the Council's procedural requirements as set out in the invitation to tender and accept the rates and contract terms set out by the Council shall be able to deliver funded provision through the flexible framework.

column4: Waste Non-hazardous Domestic Collection and Disposal Services
column5: Cardiff and Vale University Health Board has systems to ensure compliance with the Hazardous Waste Regulations 2005 (Amended 2009). These regulations require the separate treatment and disposal of a range of defined hazardous healthcare waste and segregation of the non infectious/non hazardous materials from these waste streams. In recognition of the Welsh Government policy ‘Towards Zero Waste’ (which requires an increase of recycling levels to 70 % by 2025). This will involve the collection, handling and disposal of specific waste streams in the most economic and environmentally friendly way.This is a 1-year interim contract to align to the Welsh National contract that the All Wales Central Sourcing team for NWSSP are currently compiling. The national contract will align with our All Wales sustainability strategy.
column6: The NHS Shared Services Partnership hosted by Velindre are acting on behalf of the Cardiff and Vale University local Health Board who currently has systems in place to ensure compliance with the Hazardous Waste Regulations 2005 (Amended 2009). These regulations require the separate treatment and disposal of a range of defined hazardous healthcare waste and segregation of the non infectious/non hazardous materials from these waste streams. In recognition of the Welsh Government policy ‘Towards Zero Waste’ (which requires an increase of recycling levels to 70 % by 2025). This will involve the collection, handling and disposal of specific waste streams in the most economic and environmentally friendly way.This is a 1-year interim contract to align to the Welsh National contract that the All Wales Central Sourcing team for NWSSP are currently compiling. The national contract will align with our All Wales sustainability strategy.

column4: Destination Management Organisation to Work in Partnership with Cheshire East Council to Deliver, Promote and Grow the Visitor Economy of Cheshire East
column5: Cheshire East Council (CEC) is seeking a destination management organisation (DMO) to deliver a visitor economy activity plan in support of its visitor economy strategy for Cheshire East (CE) and the area’s destination management.
column6: Cheshire East Council (CEC) is seeking a destination management organisation (DMO) to deliver a visitor economy activity plan in support of its visitor economy strategy for Cheshire East (CE) and the area’s destination management.Expectations:— recognised as a DMO by Visit England/Visit Britain,— be a partnership organisation that is able to represent the interests of its members/partners and the visitor economy/tourism sector in CE. Demonstrate a high level of skill in developing and managing such partnerships,— a CEC representative on the DMO Governance Board,— strategic leader in destination development,— lead/coordinate activities under a coherent strategy,— identify opportunities/facilitate projects and funding to maximise the availability/effective use of resources to the benefit of the sector,— engage in activity to deliver the CE visitor economy strategy and incorporate in the DMO’s destination management plan to increase the economic value of the sector.

The transition to Federalism is a top priority for the Government of Nepal.

column4: 5 Councils Corporate Services Project
column5: South Oxfordshire District Council, Havant Borough Council, Vale of White Horse District Council, Mendip District Council and Hart District Council (‘the Councils’) entered into a contract (for an initial duration of approximately 9 years) with Capita for a range of corporate and transactional services (‘the Contract’). The opportunity was advertised under OJEU Notice 2015/S 057-100137 and entered into on 4 April 2016. Further details of the original contract are set out in that OJEU notice.The Councils intend to enter into a contract variation agreement with Capita for the purposes of removing the requirement for human resources operational, payroll and finance services from the scope of the original contract.
column6: This section provides detail of the reduction of the original contract.The reduction in the I-Hub and Human Resources (Advisory) Services resulted in a reduction in contract value of approximately GBP 700 242 per year for the remainder of the contract term.The reduction in the licensing services resulted in a reduction in contract value of approximately GBP 377 000 per year for the remainder of the contract term.The reduction in the human resources operational and payroll services would result in a reduction of approximately GBP 1 012 086  per year for the remainder of the contract term.The reduction in the finance Services would result in a reduction in contract value of approximately GBP 634 000 per year for the remainder of the contract term.The reduction in the exchequer services would result in a reduction in contract value of approximately GBP 1 600 000 per year for the remainder of the contract term.Continues in Annex D1.

column4: Associated British Ports, Port of Swansea, Refurbishment of Swansea West Pier
column5: The design and build refurbishment to rehabilitate the inner section of Port of Swansea West Pier and adjacent land.The principal purpose of the scheme is to build a new wall (seaward of the existing timer structure) to stabilise the inner pier, thereby removing the dangers that the existing timber structure presents and ensuring the retention of the material behind.
column6: The tender document will include a schedule of works (prepared by the Client), which will be based on the concept design; this document will form the basis of the contractors tender.Tendering contractors will be required to price the schedule of works on a fixed priced basis. At the time of submitting his tender, the contractor will be required to identify all elements that he considers can only be priced on a provisional basis, (given the limitations of the concept design and surveys upon which the design is based).Tendering contractors will be required to submit a draft construction programme at the time of tender; the tender will not be based on a client ‘stated programme period’; the tendering contractors will be required to confirm their respective programme requirements which will be influenced by their own individual methodology, availability of resources and the imposed constraints.Tenders will be evaluated to identify the ‘Preferred Contractor’; the preferred contractor will then be appointed to the *first stage under the negotiated procedure, which is anticipated to span 7 calendar weeks to complete. Activities during the first stage anticipated to in include:— contractor to carry out further surveys necessary— contractor to amend/complete detailed design— contractor to firm up any provisional cost elements included in the tender to arrive at a fixed contract sum— contractor to update draft tender programme and submit construction programme for acceptance; contractor and client team to carry out workshop/risk review to help ensure all constraints influencing programme have been considered and provided for.*Note: as part of the tender, the contractor will be required to identify his first stage costs.At the end of the first stage, on the assumption that the contract sum is in line with the available funding, the contractor will receive award of the contract in full.

column4: QSM Auditing Scheme for Beef and Lamb
column5: AHDB needs to audit members in the United Kingdom selling quality scheme lamb and beef labelled as English and/or British, covered by an approved group voluntary beef labelling scheme under Regulation (EC) 1760/2000.
column6: AHDB are looking to continue the service of auditing of the supply chain to EN45011 standards, covering activities in the beef and lamb supply chain including abattoirs, cutting plants, wholesalers, butchers and foodservice outlets. Assurance schemes accepted are those listed under the assured food standards red tractor scheme or equivalent.Scheme membership follows from an initial declaration by the applicant that it currently meets the standards. This must be based, with the exception of retail and foodservice outlets, on its existing membership of AHDB approved assurance schemes, which are independently audited at AHDB expense. Membership based on such declarations is confirmed by the QSM Administrator (external service provider) and followed by verification of compliance after auditing visits that are the subject of this tender.The QSM Administrator works alongside the QSM audit supplier and both report to AHDB’s Senior Manager Quality Schemes. The QSM Administrator assists to arrange timelines for audit, produces and dispatches certificates upon receipt of finalised audit report, runs the QSM member hotline, QSM member database in addition to producing and dispatching QSM member materials.

column4: IT Consultancy Services to the EEA and the European Commission, Directorate-General for Environment in the Areas of Dataflow Development, Management and Operation, Inspire Support and Services
column5: The EEA, as leading contracting authority for the purpose of this inter-institutional call for tenders, seeks to establish framework service contract(s) with service providers who will assist it and the European Commission, Directorate-General for Environment (DG ENV) as participating contracting authority by providing IT consultancy services in the areas of spatial dataflow development, management and operation and Inspire support and services.The call for tender is split in 2 lots:Lot 1: Tabular and Geospatial Data Processing and Related Support;Lot 2: Metadata Cataloguing, Geospatial data Modelling and INSPIRE Support.Tenderers can apply for 1 or both lots and contracts may be signed with a different economic operator for each lot.
column6: This lot covers both consultancy services to support the Discomap infrastructure (map service platform) but also to design, implement and support the vast number of dataflows operated by EEA. EEA operates around 100 dataflows on which member states are required to report environmental data and information. Dataflows are closely operated in cooperation with the EEA thematic experts and covers air, water, emission, climate, biodiversity, etc.The processing of data is highly automated and for this purpose, several software packages are used. These include FME (Safe), ArcGIS Server/Desktop/Online (Esri), Tableau, Microsoft SQL Server, Python and C#. For certain processing of data, cloud computing (Microsoft Azure) is increasingly used, particular Azure Data Warehouse, Databricks, blob storage, Azure SQL are part of the EEA infrastructure.Expert support is needed to develop robust and automated IT solutions which can support the complete workflow from harvesting data from ReportNet (https://www.eionet.europa.eu/reportnet), performing quality control, storage in harmonised databases (SQL and geodatabase) and dissemination of data to external users or on the EEA website.

column4: EHealth, Interoperability of Health Data and Artificial Intelligence for Health and Care in the EU – SMART 2019/0056
column5: The studies will survey and analyse progress on the digital transformation of the health and care in the EU, particularly with regard to citizens’ access to their electronic health records (EHR). It will provide an overview of the current situation in the EU member states with regard to the development of interoperable EHR systems and enabling technological solutions such as electronic identification, distributed ledger and cybersecurity. The results of the study will support and inform the ongoing work of the EU and member states on the interoperability of EHR systems, in particular with regard to the development of the European EHR exchange format.
column6: Interoperability of electronic health records in the EU. The study seeks to survey and analyse progress on the digital transformation of the health and care in the EU, particularly with regard to citizens’ access to their electronic health records (EHR). It will provide an overview of the current situation in the EU member states with regard to the development of interoperable EHR systems and enabling technological solutions such as electronic identification, distributed ledger and cybersecurity. The results of the study will support and inform the ongoing work of the EU and member states on the interoperability of EHR systems, in particular with regard to the development of the European EHR exchange format.

column4: EHealth, Interoperability of Health Data and Artificial Intelligence for Health and Care in the EU – SMART 2019/0056
column5: The studies will survey and analyse progress on the digital transformation of the health and care in the EU, particularly with regard to citizens’ access to their electronic health records (EHR). It will provide an overview of the current situation in the EU member states with regard to the development of interoperable EHR systems and enabling technological solutions such as electronic identification, distributed ledger and cybersecurity. The results of the study will support and inform the ongoing work of the EU and member states on the interoperability of EHR systems, in particular with regard to the development of the European EHR exchange format.
column6: Artificial intelligence for health and care in the EU. The study aims to survey and analyse progress on the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies for the benefit of patients and health and care systems in the EU. It will provide an overview of the current situation with regard to the development, adoption and use of AI technologies and applications in the health and care sector in the EU member states. The results of the study will support and inform EU policy initiatives aiming to leverage AI and big data for digitally transforming and improving health and care in the EU.

column4: Analysis of Developments of EU Capital Flows in the Global Context
column5: The objective of this service contract is to help DG FISMA to prepare the yearly staff working documents on developments in the field of capital movements that are used by the Economic and Financial Committee (EFC) in the annual review and monitoring of the free movement of capital as required by the treaty.More specifically, the service contract will provide an external perspective to the monitoring of international financial integration that will help the Commission services and the EFC to deliver on the reporting obligations in the treaty regarding the free movement of capital. The service contract will cover developments regarding the flows and stocks of capital flows at the level of individual Member States, geographical country groupings, EU level and in the global context.
column6: In each contractual year, the work will consist in the delivery of the following report components (even though the 2 components of the study may not necessarily be in 2 different sections and can be also interlinked):1) Monitoring part — a recurring empirical analysis on developments in capital movements in the previous year and until the cut-off date of publication of the latest available data before the date of delivery of this section;2) Analytical review — should focus on elaborating a concise and policy relevant narrative regarding the identified trends and developments in the monitoring part. More specifically, it should analyse and identify the drivers underlying the trends in capital flows. It should contain an in-depth analysis of specific driver of capital movements or of a set of drivers of high relevance from a policy perspective for a given contractual year. It can consists of a conceptualization and subsequent review of a set of indicators underpinning the analysis of capital flows and their effects for financial integration.

column4: Study on the System Architecture of a Quantum Communication Infrastructure — Smart 2019/0086
column5: The objective is to specify in detail the user requirements and use cases that would drive the development of QCI, in close interaction with the participating member states. Then, based on those, proceed to the specification of an overarching (high-level) system architecture for QCI composed of space-based and terrestrial-based solutions that are secure-by design and that would cover the whole of the European Union. The objective of QCI is to enable information and data to be transmitted and stored ultra-securely and capable of linking critical public communication assets all over the Union.
column6: See Section II.1.4).

column4: Magnetic Field Shielding Surgery Rooms
column5: System to reduce low frequent magnetic fields in surgery rooms.At the moment the UMCG is preparing a huge renovation project to reorganize and rebuild it's 'hotfloor' including 24 surgery rooms and several intensive cares.To start this project the UMCG have to build 6 new operation rooms at ground floor level at first to create space for disassembling the old areas.UMCG wants to build new surgery rooms above an existing power-station (10 kV/400 V). As sensitive devices will be used in these rooms which are disturbed by magnetic fields, the surgery rooms need to be shielded in order to reach 100nTpp @ 50Hz as defined in the Dutch norm NEN1010 and ÖVE/ÖNorm E 8007 and the DIN/ VDE 0100-71.In the area with the highest magnetic field levels magnetic fields up to 31'000nTpp @ 50 Hz are expected on floor level.
column6: Market consultation magnetic field shielding surgery rooms.

column3: Laboratory, optical and precision equipments (excl. glasses)
column4: QuickShape IR Mid-IR Pulse Shaper System
column5: Aarhus University wants to purchase a QuickShape IR Mid-IR Pulse Shaper. It will be used to investigate molecular coupling and dynamics at interfaces. The devise will be integrated into an existing laser setup to provide high power ultrashort laser pulses in the mid IR spectral region. The QuickShape IR Mid-IR Pulse Shaper is he only device on the market with the ability to control the phase and shape of high power mid IR laser pulses.
column6: The customer is an associate professor at the Chemistry Department of Aarhus University and head of the surface spectroscopy facility SurfLab. We intend to purchase a pulse shaper system for a planned research project.Reactions, chemical composition and structure at interfaces are usually markedly different from those of the bulk materials. The properties of a material surface determine its performance in a given application. Typical examples include catalysis, nucleation, sensing, wetting, target binding, and biocompatibility. However, relative to bulk materials, it is extremely challenging to obtain information at ultrafast timescales about surface structure, molecular motion and energy transfer. Two-dimensional surface spectroscopy can provide this information and has proven to be a reliable tool to probe ultrafast surface processes. For a 2D experiment it is required to prepare trains of femtosecond laser pulses in the mid-IR region with exquisite control of temporal spacing, relative phase and spectral shape. The pulse must have average powers of several micro Joule, which means the pulse shaper must be optically pumped with 10-100 uJoule of average power.The customer has performed a systematic search for commercially available pulse shapers. The QuickShape IR Mid-IR Pulse Shaper is the only high-power mid-IR pulse shaper available on the market offering the pulse control needed for the experiments. This provides us with extremely high performance laser pulses which allows us to visualize molecular reactions, motions and energy transfer at interfaces with unprecedented detail.

column6: Failte Ireland requires Single Point Design and Advisory Services (SPDAT) in relation to the Wild Atlantic Way Infrastructure Improvement Project (‘the project’).The purpose of this tender competition is to procure an integrated design team for the project of the following:Stage 1– Preliminary design.Stage 2A – Developed sketch design.Stage 2B – Detailed designStage 2C – Tender documentationThe services required comprises of all the services necessary for the management and delivery of Stages 1, 2A, 2B and 2C of the project requirements including but not limited to the services listed below.The services to be provided are broadly summarised as follows:1) Fulfil the role of Project supervisor design process (PSDP) as defined under current safety, health and welfare at work legislation;2) Provide all design/engineering consultancy services required to complete the design and environmental requirements including the preparation of all associated documentation;3) Prepare all documentation for the relevant planning stages, present proposals and attend planning related meetings and respond to requests from/with the planning authorities;4) Preparation of all documentation required for successful Category 1 Application under the rural regeneration scheme.The project is comprised of 16 specific projects located within the Counties of Clare and Kerry.

column4: High Throughput Transcriptomics for the H2020 EU-ToxRisk Project
column5: In the context of the EU-ToxRisk project we require fast and affordable high throughput transcriptomics analysis. The EU-ToxRisk project is a European flagship project that aims to establish strategies for chemical safety testing that are based on non-animal approaches and aims to integrate mechanistic information into new test methods. This project involves 39 partners from academia, SME and larger industries. The project also collaborates extensively with the U.S. NIEHS/National Toxicology Program and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. The ultimate aim of the project is to provide a new safety assessment strategy for risk assessment, with the aim to provide protection of the human population for chemical exposure.

column4: Supply and Delivery of an On-Track Railway Ballast Regulator
column5: As part of IE’s strategy with regard to on track machines, it is now proposed to commence the pre-qualification process to identify a number of suitably qualified candidates to participate in the tender for the supply of an on-track ballast regulator. The contract will also include for the necessary training in the operation and maintenance of the machine to In-house IE staff and external contracting personnel.
column6: As part of IE’s strategy with regard to on track machines, it is now proposed to commence the pre-qualification process to identify a number of suitably qualified candidates to participate in the tender for the supply of an on-track ballast regulator. The contract will also include for the necessary training in the operation and maintenance of the machine to In-house IE staff and external contracting personnel.The Ballast regulator must:— be self-propelled at transit speeds of 100 km/h;— be fitted with a cab at either end of the machine for bio-directional movement (driven from both cabs);— be capable of working on IE’s Infrastructure Permanent Way Gauge for on-track machines with a track gauge of 1 600 mm;— be supplied with shoulder ploughs, centre ploughs, brush boxes, rail fastening brushes, conveying systems and hoppers;— be capable of hauling or propelling other on-track machines;— be designed, manufactured, tested and delivered accordance with EN 14033-1, EN 14033-2 and EN14033-3 and all related standards;— be a CE marked vehicle complete with a declaration of conformity with all applicable directives;— comply with all relevant Technical Standards for Interoperability (TSI’s).Options such as obstacle avoidance systems, ballast compacting/stabilising systems, ballast profile measurement recording systems, dust suppression systems may also form part of the contract.Other innovations or enhancements may also be considered.The winning contractor will be required to participate and cooperate with IE’s safety validation process and Commission for Railway Regulation approval (CRR) for introducing new equipment on to IE’s network.

column4: Agreement Covering Software Quality Assurance Including Software end-to-end Capabilities, Code Inspection and Data Cleansing
column5: This contract will be concluded with Nordic RSC. Nordic RSC (Regional Security Coordinator) is as a joint office owned by Energinet, Fingrid, Svenska Kraftnät and Statnett with the purpose of delivering operational coordination in the Nordic electricity system. Nordic RSC has concluded a contract with GRID Solutions Denmark, Filial AF Grid Solutions SAS, Frankrig, Strevelinsvej 8, Erritsø, 7000 Fredericia, Company Registration Number 27550835 on development of an infrastructure critical application. In this regard Nordic RSC needs an agreement covering software quality assurance including software end-to-end capabilities and code inspection on behalf of the Nordic Regional Security Coordinator and data cleansing. The Nordic RSC request a partner with software assessing capabilities in relation to infrastructure critical applications and with the ability to both provide professional consulting and/or assist with skills to support both Nordic RSC as well as the supplier of the application under the development. The partner shall be able to provide documentation for the ability to handle both the assessor role, as well as support with strong skills in the development/test process with this not being a conflict of interest. Nordic RSC needs among others the partner to assess the software requirement specification, software architecture specification, supplier’s software factory setup, the application code, the requirement traceability matrix, verification and validation.
column6: This contract will be concluded with Nordic RSC. Nordic RSC (Regional Security Coordinator) is as a joint office owned by Energinet, Fingrid, Svenska Kraftnät and Statnett with the purpose of delivering operational coordination in the Nordic electricity system. Nordic RSC has concluded a contract with GRID Solutions Denmark, Filial AF Grid Solutions SAS, Frankrig, Strevelinsvej 8, Erritsø, 7000 Fredericia, Company Registration Number 27550835 on development of an infrastructure critical application. In this regard Nordic RSC needs an agreement covering software quality assurance including software end-to-end capabilities and code inspection on behalf of the Nordic Regional Security Coordinator and data cleansing. The Nordic RSC request a partner with software assessing capabilities in relation to infrastructure critical applications and with the ability to both provide professional consulting and/or assist with skills to support both Nordic RSC as well as the supplier of the application under the development. The partner shall be able to provide documentation for the ability to handle both the assessor role, as well as support with strong skills in the development/test process with this not being a conflict of interest. Nordic RSC needs among others the partner to assess the software requirement specification, software architecture specification, supplier’s software factory setup, the application code, the requirement traceability matrix, verification and validation.

column4: Sequencing on Human Exome and Genome
column5: Sequencing on human exome and genome.
column6: WESNext generation sequencing on whole human exome (targeting >99 % of regions in the consensus coding sequence-CCDS, RefSeq and Gencode databases) with Agilent’s SureSelect Human All Exon V6 kit, updated or equivalent. The generated library should be sequenced on an Illumina platform or equivalent with an average coverage depth of 100x and ~97% of the targeted bases should be covered more than 10x. Bioinformatics pipeline for the data should include base calling, alignment of reads to GRCh37/hg19 genome assembly and FASTQ, BAM and VCF files should be provided. The turnover time for the analysis should be less than 30 working days. The final data from the analysis should be provided on cloud with no additional cost and should be available for download within 3 weeks. Companies that will provide annotated variants and CNV reports will be given priority.WGSNext generation sequencing on whole human genome. The sequencing should be done with Illumina chemistry or equivalent. The generated library should be sequenced on an Illumina platform or equivalent with an average coverage depth of 30x and ~95% of the bases should be covered more than 15x. Bioinformatics pipeline for the data should include base calling, alignment of reads to GRCh37/hg19 genome assembly and FASTQ, BAM and VCF files should be provided. The turnover time for the analysis should be less than 30 working days. The final data from the analysis should be provided on cloud with no additional cost and should be available for download within 3 weeks. Companies that will provide annotated variants and CNV reports will be given priority.

column4: E.1 Turnkey Contract for Gruben Primary School (1)
column5: The new school building with 3 floors must be constructed in accordance with the passive house standard and it must be made of solid wood structures for all columns, most of the beams, surfaces, outer walls (climate-adaptive building shell) and a selected number of inner walls. The mid-section of the building shall contain a common room (‘Gruben’) that goes over all floors. Technical ventilation rooms are located on the roof. Air conditioning systems are to be conveyed down in vertical shafts and distributed via main channels in the corridors. The mid-section of the building, in the longitudinal direction, the contracting authority is planning to construct low beams for good ability to navigate to technical plants above the ceiling. The gross area of the school is approx. 5 520 m

column4: EEA 055-2019 Small Crew Vehicle for Bergen Fire Service
column5: Bergen fire service shall procure a small crew vehicle that shall be used in densely populated areas with narrow streets and alleys in the central areas of Bergen.
column6: The width of the vehicle must not exceed 2 150 mm excluding mirrors, which must be electrically folded from the driver's position.The vehicle must contain a cutting extinguisher of 300 bar that distributes 50 L water per minute.The vehicle must have a cabin with 2 + 2 doors and be equipped with a total of 5 seats, with 2 front seats and 3 back seats with integrated RD devices.The engine size must not be less than 210 hp (Diesel engine).The transmission must be fully automatic.The vehicle must have dual rear wheels and have the lowest possible centre of gravity.The addition must contain a water-tank (as big as possible) with the possibility of refilling water, with 65 mm intake on the tank.The vehicle must have side-cabinets with rolling doors and space for equipment such as electric fans, hose material, door-forcing equipment, etc.The vehicle must also be equipped with a foam system (CAFS or equivalent).

column4: Special Reagents for Genetic Analyses HUNT
column5: Reagents on glass pates that will be used to carry out genetical analyses of new participants in HUNT, recruited through HUNT4. 70 000 analyses have been carried out so far on HUNT participants with the same reagents, an analysis tool that is tailor made for use on HUNT participants.
column6: Reagents on glass pates that will be used to carry out genetical analyses of new participants in HUNT, recruited through HUNT4. 70 000 analyses have been carried out so far on HUNT participants with the same reagents, an analysis tool that is tailor made for use on HUNT participants. It is methodologically important to avoid batch-effect in such analyses, i.e., prevent different analysis tools introducing methodological error sources.

column4: Announcement of Contract Signing for the Purchase of Consultancy Services for Management Development
column5: The Norwegian Meteorological Institute (Norwegian abbreviation MET) wants to enter into a framework agreement for consultancy service for management development. MET has a specific coming need but wants to enter into a contract that can also cover MET's ongoing need for assistance for a period of 2 years with an option for 1 + 1 year extension. Further call-offs are dependent on budgetary frames and the chosen management development programme.A thorough description of the assignment is given in Annex 1 to the contract (the requirement specification).

column4: 1012302 Saemien Sijte — South Sami Museum and Culture Centre H001 Builder's Representative and Safety, Health and Work Environment Coordinator
column5: Statsbygg [the Directorate of Public Construction and Property] requests, in connection with project: 1012302 Saemien Sijte — South Sami museum and culture centre tenders for a builder's representative (BHO).
column6: The contract for builder's representative also includes the task as safety, health and work environment coordinator for the engineering design phase (KP) and the execution phase (KU).The Ministry of Culture has given Statsbygg the task of executing the construction project for Saemien Sijte, based on a ‘simplified preliminary project’ (hereafter called the ‘draft project’) from 2017. The new building will be approx. 1 600 mThe site is at Horjemstangen in Snåsa. The development plan was prepared and approved 2010-2011. The site is not developed. The establishment of the technical infrastructure and access roads are included in the project.

column4: System for Financial Follow-up in Projects (Project Management System)
column5: Procurement of a 'system for financial follow-up in projects (project management system)' for investment projects in the Agency for Urban Environment.The Agency for Urban Environment manages communal areas such as streets, squares, parks, recreational areas, sports facilities, countryside, and inner Oslo fjord. The Agency for Urban Environment is also responsible for air, noise, water, and soil. The Agency's goal is to make Oslo a safe, beautiful, environmentally friendly and sporty city.The system is a vital management tool for financial management in the Agency for Urban Environment, and the objective of the procurement is that project managers get a better and more user-friendly tool that gives both project managers and managers a better overview of progress and central financial key parameters in the projects.See the tender documentation, including the annexes for more information.
column6: Procurement of a 'system for financial follow-up in projects (project management system)' for investment projects in the Agency for Urban Environment.In order to manage the finances and general status in this portfolio in an efficient and professional way, there is a need for a system that secures the performance measurements connected to time, cost and quality in the projects.The system is a vital management tool for financial management in the Agency for Urban Environment, and the objective of the procurement is that project managers get a better and more user-friendly tool that gives both project managers and managers a better overview of progress and central financial key parameters in the projects.See the tender documentation, including the annexes for more information.

column4: 20200013 Team Development
column5: The Norwegian tax administration shall enter into a contract for support to a method for communication and interaction (team development). It is particularly important that the provider's tool for using the method is certified by an impartial certification body and the ability to verify that a given work-psychological test tool meets specified requirements, which can be regarded as generally accepted by the Norwegian academic community.The provider's tool must be based on a method using a questionnaire (paper copies and on-line system) which shall measure the preferences for communication, interaction and various problem solving styles. This is a preference test and must not be confused with a personality test.Areas of application: communication training, staff and management groups development, cross-culture and diversity training, conflict management etc.
column6: See point: II.1.4) A brief descriptionIn addition:• must be able to provide an online system;• have a low threshold for use and implementation and by this providing applicability;• no certification cost for facilitator/user of the tool;• have a large degree of customer adaptations, generating data, etc.;• the method (tool) must be just as suitable for use in both small groups (4-10 persons) and in large groups (+200 persons).

column4: Framework Agreement for External Warning Service
column5: Bane NOR has established a warning system for receipt of warnings on culpable conditions. The compliance officer has been responsible for the case management of the warnings since 2018. The purpose of the warning system is to clear up unwanted situations and provide security for the whistle-blower and the person subject to a warning. The external warning reception is a part of Bane NOR SF's emphasis on prevention and exposure of corruption and misconduct and other culpable and illegal conditions.The objective of the tender competition is to enter into an agreement with an external provider for the continuation and operation of external reception of warnings. The warnings can be sent internally, from the customer, suppliers/contract parties or outsiders.
column6: The objective of the tender competition is to enter into an agreement with an external provider for the continuation and operation of external notification reception system. The notifications may be sent internally, from the customer, suppliers/contract parties or outsiders.General information about the deliveryBane NOR has established a warning system for receipt of warnings on culpable conditions. The compliance officer has been responsible for the case management of the warnings since 2018. The purpose of the warning system is to clear up unwanted situations and provide security for the whistle-blower and the person subject to a warning. The external warning reception is a part of Bane NOR SF's emphasis on prevention and exposure of corruption and misconduct and other culpable and illegal conditions.The compliance officer is the receiver of the notifications and brings the warnings to the notification secretariat's weekly meetings. In addition to the compliance officer, the notification secretariat has the head of governance in the legal department and the head of the HR managers. The notification secretariat is responsible for the handling of warnings in accordance with the group warning procedure. The compliance officer submits annual reports to the group management and the board for notification cases.

column5: The Council is undertaking a single procurement exercise in respect of two contracts:Lot 1: Highway Improvements and Civil Engineering Works (HICEW);Lot 2: Highway Maintenance and Minor Works (HMMW).
column6: Lot 1: Highway Improvements and Civil Engineering Works (HICEW).The requirement for the HICEW contract comprises the undertaking of highway improvements and other civil engineering works throughout the London Borough of Bexley.The works will include new highway works and widening of existing highways, bridge strengthening and small bridge replacement schemes, highway drainage schemes designed to solve local flooding problems, watercourse restoration works, regeneration projects in town centres and other areas, local safety schemes and other highway improvement works, parks infrastructure projects and works to Council car parks.
